text.p: These are the leading stories in the Zimbabwe press on Friday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
_ Zimbabwe's bid to have a ban on ivory trade partially lifted has received a jolt from the Kenyan delegation to the ongoing CITES meeting, which called for the embargo to stay.
- The weak financial position of the Zimbabwe National Chamber of Commerce threatens to derail current efforts to merge it with the Confederation of Zimbabwe Industries.
- The Southern African Development Community has agreed to speak with one voice at the ongoing CITES meeting, in an effort to improve the chances of adoption of various proposals.
- Extensive vandalism of equipment and spares valued at an estimated Z$5 million will delay the start of production at Zimbabwean textile giant Mod-Zone Enterprises, formerly Cone Textiles.
- A cotton price war -- which is expected to boost farmers' earnings -- is looming between the state-owned Cotton Company of Zimbabwe and Cargill, industry sources said.
